Sentencas: Direct evidences of cerium valence state transformation from Ce4+ to Ce3+ in an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell after long-term operation have been identified.
Titulo: Chemical state identification of Ce3+/Ce4+ in the Sm0.2Ce0.8o2-δ electrolyte for an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell after long-term operation

Sentencas: Single cell with samarium-doped ceria (Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-delta, SDC) thin film electrolyte is prepared with maximum power density of 608 mW cm(-2) at 650 degrees C when the fuel/oxidant flow rates are 335/1005 sccm, respectively.
Titulo: Chemical state identification of Ce3+/Ce4+ in the Sm0.2Ce0.8o2-δ electrolyte for an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell after long-term operation

Sentencas: The long-term durability tests are executed by fixed-current operation for 950 h.
Titulo: Chemical state identification of Ce3+/Ce4+ in the Sm0.2Ce0.8o2-δ electrolyte for an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell after long-term operation

Sentencas: The power density and voltage degradation are observed and critically attributed to the chemical state transformation of cerium in the electrolyte.
Titulo: Chemical state identification of Ce3+/Ce4+ in the Sm0.2Ce0.8o2-δ electrolyte for an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell after long-term operation

Sentencas: From X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), the Ce3+ ratio increases from 303 to 52.9% in the electrolyte before and after operation.
Titulo: Chemical state identification of Ce3+/Ce4+ in the Sm0.2Ce0.8o2-δ electrolyte for an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell after long-term operation

Sentencas: The focused ion beam (FIB)/transmission electron microscopy (TEM) techniques are utilized to investigate the structure variation and the selected area diffraction patterns of the chosen grains towards electrodes identify the phase transformation from CeO2 to Ce2O3, suggesting that the Ce3+ species increase at the near-anode side.
Titulo: Chemical state identification of Ce3+/Ce4+ in the Sm0.2Ce0.8o2-δ electrolyte for an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell after long-term operation

Sentencas: The direct evidence of Ce3+ presence shows one of the key factors for the degradation of a low temperature solid oxide fuel cell (LT-SOFC).
Titulo: Chemical state identification of Ce3+/Ce4+ in the Sm0.2Ce0.8o2-δ electrolyte for an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell after long-term operation
